widget.title: Panel
widget.p: Panel is a container with a layout manager similar to GridBagLayout. The following example is similar to BorderLayout. This panel has 5 components, the first row contains only the 'North' component, the second row has 3 components, and the last has only the 'South' one. The extra space is distributed to the 2nd row and the 2nd column. The gap between the components and on the border are 4pt.
widget.xul: <panel columns="3" gap="4" top="4" left="4" bottom="4" right="4"> <textfield text="North" colspan="3" /> <label text="East" /> <textarea text="Center" weightx="1" weighty="1" /> <label text="West" /> <textfield text="South" colspan="3" /> </panel>

parameters.parameter: Specifies the number of available cells in a row. Default 0 value specifies 1 row and unlimited cell columns.
The border gap from the top. It specifies the space that the panel must leave.
The blank space from the left.
The blank space from the bottom.
The blank space from the right.
The horizontal and vertical gap between components.
The text string that the dialog title displays.
The icon image that the dialog title displays.
name, enabled, visible, tooltip, property, width, height, colspan, rowspan, weightx, weighty, halign, and valign parameters are similar to component
